input_text:
Job Title: Technical Lead

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
Company:At CodeMonk, we’re venturing into new territories, shaping the future of diverse and decentralised teams. We know finding the right talents and teams is a major challenge in today’s skills market. That’s why we’re creating a gateway for companies to access the best global talents and teams that are agile and match their business needs.
Through this platform, employers can efficiently and compliantly hire, manage, and pay flexible tech talents and teams anywhere in the world. While reducing costs significantly.
As the world of tech work increasingly embraces a remote-first approach, we’re dedicated to redefining employer-employee working relationships. Our mission is to empower employees with better pay, the opportunity to build world-changing tech solutions, increased work flexibility, and a promising career path.
Website:http://www.codemonk.ai
Skills: Python, Shell, PowerShell, AWS, Azure, GCP, CI/CD pipelines, Jenkins, GitLab CI/CD, Circle CI, Chef, Puppet, Ansible, Docker, Terraform, Cloud Formation, Prometheus, Grafana, ELK Stack, Splunk Key Responsibilities:• Lead the design, implementation, and maintenance of CI/CD pipelines to automate software delivery processes.• Architect and manage infrastructure as code using tools like Terraform, Ansible, or CloudFormation.• Develop and maintain monitoring, logging, and alerting systems to ensure high availability and performance.• Implement and optimize containerization and orchestration solutions using Docker and Kubernetes.• Collaborate with development and operations teams to troubleshoot issues and optimize workflows.• Design and implement security measures and compliance standards across the infrastructure.• Stay updated with the latest DevOps tools, technologies, and best practices.• Mentor junior team members and provide technical guidance and support.• Proficiency in scripting languages like Python, Shell, or PowerShell.• Experience with cloud platforms like AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud.• Strong understanding of CI/CD pipelines and tools such as Jenkins, GitLab CI/CD, or CircleCI.• Knowledge of configuration management tools like Chef, Puppet, or Ansible.• Familiarity with containerization technologies such as Docker and container orchestration tools like Kubernetes.• Expertise in infrastructure as code (IaC) principles and tools like Terraform, Ansible, or CloudFormation.• Experience with monitoring and logging tools such as Prometheus, Grafana, ELK Stack, or Splunk.• Understanding of networking concepts and security best practices.• Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.• Ability to work independently and in a team environment, with good communication skills.• Professional experience in DevOps or a related field, with experience in a senior role preferred.
Why we think you'll love working with us:We are early stage and already a profitable venture.You will be part of the journey we’re on, so we offer equity options for important roles along with competitive salary.It will be an exciting stage to join as we are looking to raise our first substantial round this year.Beyond this, there’s plenty more that makes us a great place to work:We are fully remote company with flexible workingWe do not follow 9-5 and work when we are at our best30 days Paid Time OffRegular remote socials with global teamsRegular bounties and other campaigns for you to winPlus more rewards as we grow

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level

output_json.title: Technical Lead
output_json.summary: Lead the design, implementation, and maintenance of CI/CD pipelines, architect and manage infrastructure, develop monitoring systems, implement security measures, mentor team members, and stay updated with the latest DevOps tools.
job_responsibilities: Lead the design, implementation, and maintenance of CI/CD pipelines to automate software delivery processes.
Architect and manage infrastructure as code using tools like Terraform, Ansible, or CloudFormation.
Develop and maintain monitoring, logging, and alerting systems to ensure high availability and performance.
Implement and optimize containerization and orchestration solutions using Docker and Kubernetes.
Collaborate with development and operations teams to troubleshoot issues and optimize workflows.
Design and implement security measures and compliance standards across the infrastructure.
Stay updated with the latest DevOps tools, technologies, and best practices.
Mentor junior team members and provide technical guidance and support.
benefits: Exciting stage to join with potential for substantial round funding
Fully remote company with flexible working hours
Additional rewards as the company grows
output_json.company_information: CodeMonk is a platform enabling companies to access global tech talents and teams, facilitating efficient hiring, management, and payment processes.

other.content: Company: At CodeMonk, we’re venturing into new territories, shaping the future of diverse and decentralised teams. We know finding the right talents and teams is a major challenge in today’s skills market. That’s why we’re creating a gateway for companies to access the best global talents and teams that are agile and match their business needs.

other.section_name: Why we think you’ll love working with us
other.content: We are early stage and already a profitable venture. You will be part of the journey we’re on, so we offer equity options for important roles along with competitive salary. It will be an exciting stage to join as we are looking to raise our first substantial round this year. Beyond this, there’s plenty more that makes us a great place to work: We are fully remote company with flexible working, we do not follow 9-5 and work when we are at our best, 30 days Paid Time Off, regular remote socials with global teams, regular bounties and other campaigns for you to win, plus more rewards as we grow.
